articles.author: Will Dunham
articles.description: Jimmy Carter, the earnest Georgia peanut farmer who as U.S. president struggled with a bad economy and the Iran hostage crisis but brokered peace between Israel and Egypt and later received the Nobel Peace Prize for his humanitarian work, died at his home in Plains, Georgia, on Sunday, the Carter Center said. He was 100.
articles.title: Jimmy Carter, former US president and Nobel Peace Prize recipient, dead at 100

articles.author: Ju-Min Park, Hongji Kim
articles.description: Investigators are examining bird strikes and weather conditions as possible factors in the crash.
articles.title: South Korea orders air safety probe after worst crash in country kills 179

articles.author: Stephen Grey, John Shiffman, Grant Smith
articles.description: Chemicals factories founded or owned by some of Russia's wealthiest men are supplying ingredients to plants that manufacture explosives used by Moscow's military during the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Exclusive: The Russian billionaires whose chemical factories fuel Russia's war machine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said Hamas militants were the targets of the strike on Gaza City's Al Wafa hospital, which the Palestinian civil defence said killed seven people.
articles.title: WHO chief calls for end to hospital attacks in Gaza after strike

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's joint investigation unit has requested an arrest warrant for suspended President Yoon Suk Yeol over his short-lived imposition of martial law earlier this month, the Yonhap news agency reported on Monday.
articles.title: S.Korea joint investigation unit requests arrest warrant for Yoon over martial law, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Syria's de facto ruler Ahmed al-Sharaa held talks on Monday with a senior Ukrainian delegation led by Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiha, the Syrian state news agency (SANA) reported, as Kyiv moves to build ties with the new leadership in Damascus.
articles.title: Syria's de facto leader hosts Ukraine's foreign minister, SANA says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 60 people died in Ethiopia when a truck packed with passengers plunged into a river, authorities in the southern Sidama region said.
articles.title: At least 60 killed in Ethiopia road accident

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three foreigners were killed after a fire broke out at a hotel near Bangkok's popular backpacker district on Sunday night, authorities said, with seven others being treated in hospital.
articles.title: Three foreigners die in Bangkok hotel fire, authorities say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A South Korean Jeju Air passenger jet crashed on landing at Muan International Airport on Sunday, killing 179 people in the country's deadliest air disaster.
articles.title: South Korea air crash: Inside the final minutes of Jeju Air flight

articles.author: Nailia Bagirova
articles.description: Azerbaijan on Sunday paid tribute to the pilots and passengers of the Azerbaijan Airlines passenger plane that crashed in Kazakhstan killing 38 people after Russian air defences were used against Ukrainian drones.
articles.title: Azerbaijan pays tribute to pilots and passengers who perished in air crash
